description.narrative: The project help to establish an effective system to integrate climate change adaptation into government administration processes in the priority sectors

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Sub-Outcome 1.1. - Integrated climate and socioeconomic data and information system is built and made available to selected priority agencies (especially MARD and MOT). - Capacity to analyses climate change impacts on priority sectors is strengthened to effectively integrate climate change into the planning and budgeting process of priority government agencies (especially MARD and MOT).
Sub-Outcome 1.2: - Selected sector guidelines to integrate climate change adaptation responses into the sectoral plans are available. Prioritized and compiled adaptation measures available. - As on one of the implementation activities during 2016-2020 under the Plan for Implementation of the Paris Agreement, the NAP will be developed and completed by 2019.
Sub-outcome 2.1: - Capacity to improve effectiveness of inter-ministerial coordination enhanced. - Climate change adaptation appraisal capacity strengthened in MPI and priority sectors.
Sub-outcome 2.2: Adaptation Financing Strategy and actionable measures focusing on unlocking private sector investment prepared and adopted.
Sub-outcome 3.1: Participatory and Result-Based M&E framework and implementation guideline completed and used in priority sectors

comment.narrative:
Sub-Outcome 1.1: Viet Nam has a comprehensive national socioeconomic as well as climate data and information system from its weather stations throughout the country. Effective and timely integration between the climate data and socio-economic data has yet to be established and made available to relevant users.
Sub-Outcome 1.2: Climate change policies and strategies are in place in Viet Nam. The Plan for Implementation of the Paris Agreement is the latest instrument that the government is using to bring climate response from policy to actions. However, gaps exist within line ministries relating to identifying climate impacts and integrating climate change adaptation responses into sectoral specific plans and budgets.
Sub-outcome 2.1: Climate change related issues are coordinated by the National Climate Change Committee (NCCC) but NCCC is mainly a policy advisory body with MONRE serving as a Secretariat. Although MPI has adopted the Adaptation Prioritization framework (APRF), which takes relevant climate change adaptation actions into the normal project design and appraisal procedures of the SED, capacity of other line ministries in adopting similar adaptation prioritization framework have not been clearly demonstrated.
Sub-outcome 2.2: The NDC states that the Government of Vietnam can only finance one-third of the total costs of climate change adaptation. With increasing limited international public resources, participation and investment from national and international private sector needs to be unlocked.
Sub-outcome 3.1: M&E is included as key component of the NDC and as one of the main objectives of the Plan for Implementation of the Paris Agreement. Progress has been made to track public climate expenditures for priority sectors through the CPEIR exercise. However, CPEIR focused mainly on flow of fund with limited participation from wider stakeholders. To measure outcome/results of adaptation response measures, a more robust M&E system and operational proced
The project get started in 2020 and Project inception plan initiated

Although the project was approved in Nov 2019, due to the conditional requirement of GCF, the project could not started until UNDP - GCF amended framework agreement for NAP Readiness.
The Project started on 17 August 2020. MONRE completed the project approval process following ODA procedures in Sept 2020 and only be able to form the project team in Nov 2020.
Inception Phase for the Project implementation completed by the end of 2020.

Sub-Outcome 1.1. - Integrated climate and socioeconomic data and information system is designed. - Capacity to analyses climate change impacts on priority sectors is provided to line ministries for their further application in the next year.
Sub-Outcome 1.2: - Selected sector guidelines to integrate climate change adaptation responses into the sectoral plans are available in at least 1 line ministry e.g. MOT - Under the Plan for Implementation of the Paris Agreement, the NAP technical report will be developed and ready for Government submission to UNFCCC by 2021 or early 2022.
Sub-outcome 2.1: - Climate change adaptation appraisal capacity strengthened in MPI and priority sectors.
Sub-outcome 2.2: Initiated discussion on Adaptation Financing Strategy and actionable measures focusing on unlocking private sector investment
Sub-outcome 3.1: Drafted Participatory and Result-Based M&E framework and implementation guideline

Sub-Outcome 1.1. - Draft completed. A system of climate risk impacts and key sectoral risks and vulnerabilities for climate adaptation was designed, including key climate, socioeconomic data and risk information - Progressed and on track. An initial training/capacity building to analyses climate change impacts on priority sectors is provided to line ministries and provinces. The training material will be further revised for replication in 2022.
Sub-Outcome 1.2: - Progressed and on track. A draft overall guideline to integrate climate change adaptation responses into the sectoral plans are available at the final stage for submission to Government for approval. The guidelines for selected sectors (Agriculture, Transport) are under development - NAP technical report was postponed due to some delay progress from sectoral report. The NAP technical report will be developed and ready by mid-2022 and will be ready for submission to UNFCCC by the end of 2022
Sub-outcome 2.1: - Progressed with some delay. A draft technical assessment procedure on climate change adaptation project appraisal was prepared but require further technical consultation with line ministries for building synergy. Once the guideline is done, a handbook for provinces and line ministries on CCA project appraisal will be prepared for all adaptation projects.
Sub-outcome 2.2: Progressed and on tracked. The project-initiated discussion on key bottlenecks for private sector engagement in CCA and Adaptation Financing Strategy and actionable measures focusing on unlocking private sector investment in NAP in the future
Sub-outcome 3.1: Progressed and almost completed. Drafted Participatory and Result-Based M&E framework and implementation guideline. The Draft has been submitted to the Government for approval.

Sub-Outcome 1.1. - Completed an integrated climate and socioeconomic data and information system for NAP - Improved capacity for climate change impacts assessment and risk assessment with standardize processes in all prioritized sectors and by NAP.
Sub-Outcome 1.2: - A national guideline and sectoral guidelines to integrate climate change adaptation responses into the sectoral plans are available - NAP technical report developed and ready for Government submission to UNFCCC.
Sub-outcome 2.1: - Systematic guideline on climate change adaptation appraisal available and capacity strengthened in MPI and priority sectors.
Sub-outcome 2.2: - Completed full assessment on bottlenecks to engage private sectors in CCA and initial plan for CCA Financing Strategy under NAP is available, including measures for unlocking private sector investments
Sub-outcome 3.1: Finalized Participatory and Result-Based M&E framework and implementation guidelines available and disseminated at the national and provincial level.
